instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight
threads.message:
I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board whose keyboard backlight is not working. I tried with a new working backlight strip and that did not work as well. I took some measurements of the backlight driver and connector with the backlight plugged in.

J7715
Pins 1/2 - 0v
Pins 3/4 - 4.94v

<CHIP>U7750</CHIP> 
Pin 1  - 4.94v
Pin 2 - 5.01v
Pin 7 - 5.01v
Pins 3/4/5/6/8 - 0v

I checked on a probe point for <SIGNAL>SMC_SYS_KBDLED</SIGNAL> and there was no signal. There was liquid damage near the SMC before I UC'ed the machine.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight
threads.message: When you adjust the backlight do you get the forbidden sign? Are you covering up the isight to make ALS think it is dark?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight
threads.message:
Yes when I hit the keyboard backlight button I get the forbidden sign. When I cover the isight camera the brightness on the screen dims but still no light on the keyboard.

Update: I did some google searches on this and read that once I cover the isight camera I would then be able to the adjust the keyboard brightness. That solved the issue.

Thanks Duke!
